ticket.title: Remove migrate directory on last destroy
ticket.original-body:
This is petty, but..
When you create a new rails app, no 'migrate' directory is created in the 'db' directory. If you generate a model, the 'migrate' directory is created, but if you then destroy that model (the last or only model) the migrate directory is left in-tact.
Like I said, it's petty and small, but it seems that the logic should be followed thru.

When you create a new rails app, no 'migrate' directory is created in the 'db' directory. If you generate a model, the 'migrate' directory is created, but if you then destroy that model (the last or only model) the migrate directory is left in-tact.

version.title: Remove migrate directory on last destroy

version.body: Why complicate things? Is there any issue if the migrate directory remains in-tact?
version.body-html: Why complicate things? Is there any issue if the migrate directory remains in-tact?
version.title: Remove migrate directory on last destroy

version.body:
First of all: Yes, that is petty. Secondly: I agree with Rohit.
To be honest I think `db/migrate` should just be there by default.
version.body-html:
First of all: Yes, that is petty. Secondly: I agree with Rohit.

To be honest I think db/migrate should just be there by default.
version.title: Remove migrate directory on last destroy

version.body: I think it's fine just the way it is. :)
version.body-html: I think it's fine just the way it is. :)
version.title: Remove migrate directory on last destroy
